original: Historical observations of phenological events have provided insights into the progression of the natural calendar since ancient agricultural times. Many cultures possess traditional phenological proverbs and sayings that indicate optimal times for agricultural actions. For example, one saying advises, "When the sloe tree is white as a sheet, sow your barley whether it be dry or wet." Other proverbs attempt to forecast future weather co
